resources.string: Dip into 7.00 pH solution, stir gently and let it stand still
Dip into 4.00 pH solution, stir gently and let it stand still
Dip into 4.01 pH solution, stir gently and let it stand still
Dip into 9.18 pH solution, stir gently and let it stand still
Dip into 10.01 pH solution, stir gently and let it stand still
Dip into 1.68 pH solution, stir gently and let it stand still
Dip into 12.45 pH solution, stir gently and let it stand still
Dip into 6.86 pH solution, stir gently and let it stand still
Dip into 1.68 pH solution, stir gently and let it stand still
Dip into 12.46 solution, stir gently and let it stand still
Dip into 1413 solution, stir gently and let it stand still
Dip into 84 solution, stir gently and let it stand still
Dip into 12.88 solution, stir gently and let it stand still
Shake-dry or blot-dry (NEVER rub the sensor)
Potential problems and how to fix
Two passwords should be the same.
Password is empty or contains space
When conductivity calibrate finish, TDS, Salinity or Resistivity auto calibrated
Please wait for a stable reading before pressing ENT
Readings being unstable for a long time
pH Electrode zero potential of pH probe out of range（<60mV or>60mV）
Slope of pH probe out of range（<85% or >110%）

1. Please fully immerse the probe into calibration solution.
 2. The first point of calibration must be pH 7.00.
 3. Please check if the calibration solution is good – not expired or contaminated
 4. Please check if the probe is damaged (e.g. broken glass sensor or a crack on the sensor). If so, please replace the probe.
 5. The glass sensor or junction of the probe could get contaminated severely. Please use a soft brush dipped with soap water to clean the probe, then rinse it with purified water, and soak it in 3M KCL for 24 hours before use again.
 6. For other problems, please contact us at 614–285–3080 or info@aperainst.com
None. Wait for the smiley face to come up and stay on screen, then press ENT

1. Please check if there is any air bubble inside the glass bulb sensor. If so, please shake the meter with force for several times to remove the air bubble(s).
 2. Please check if the probe is damaged (e.g. broken glass sensor or a crack on the sensor). If so, please replace the probe.
 3. The glass bulb sensor or junction of the probe could get contaminated severely. Please use a soft brush dipped with soap water to clean the probe, then rinse it with purified water, and soak it in 3M KCL for 24 hours before use again.
 4. The probe could be severely aged (response time is significantly slow; used for over 1 year). Please replace the probe.
 5. This tester is not suitable for testing your sample. Please contact us to find a proper model most suitable for your application.
 6. For other problems, please contact us at 614–285–3080 or info@aperainst.com

1. Check if the standard series setup in the pH parameter setting is consistent with the calibration solutions’(U.S.A standard is 4.00, 7.00, 10.01; NIST standard is 4.00, 6.86, 9.18)
 2. Check if the calibration solutions got expired or contaminated.
 3. Please check if the probe is damaged (e.g. broken glass sensor or a crack on the sensor). If so, please replace the probe.
 4. Electrode invalidated (Error 4 or Error 5 show up consistently after calibration while the above 3 problems are excluded). Please replace the electrode;
 5. The probe could be severely aged (response time is significantly slow; used for over 1 year). Please replace the probe；
 6. For other problems, please contact us at 614–285–3080 or info@aperainst.com
Please enter calibration mode and perform calibration; or enter general settings to cancel the calibration reminder
Press back key again to exit
ORP calibration currently can only be operated at the ORP60-Z tester.

PH60-DE: for regular water solutions\' pH test PH60F-DE: for flat surface test e.g. skin, paper, fabrics, leather, and samll volume liquid test PH60S-DE: for soft solid samples e.g. cheese, sushi rice, meat, soil etc. EC60-E: for regular water solutions\' Conductivity/TDS/salinity/resistivity test ORP60-DA: for regular water solutions\' ORP test PC60-DE: for regular water solutions\' pH and conductivity/TDS/salinity/resistivity test

General water solutions e.g. pools& spas, hydroponics, aquaculture, aquarium, water treatment, environmental monitoring, beverage making, education, cooling towers, etc. \nP.S.: General water solutions are non-viscous liquids that have medium to high ion concentration, at which temperature is 5 to 50˚C, pH is 2 to 12, and don’t contain proteins or sulfides.
pH,conductivity,TDS, salinity, resistivity, temperature, ORP (a separate probe needed)

PC60-DE: for pH/conductivity/TDS/salinity/resistivity measurement of general water solutions (conductivity measurement range: 0 to 20 mS/20,000 µS)
 PH60-DE: for pH measurement of general water solutions
 PH60S-DE: for direct pH measurement of food samples e.g. fruits, cheese, dough, sushi rice, yogurt, jam, sauce, butter, cream, etc.
 PH60F-DE: for pH measurement on flat samples e.g. paper, skin, textiles, leather, carpet, etc.
 GS2-E: for direct pH measurement of soil (with a spear sensor)
 EC60-DE: for conductivity/TDS/salinity/resistivity measurement of water solutions (conductivity measurement range: 0 to 20 mS/20,000 µS)
 ORP60-DA: for ORP test of general water solutions (ORP measurement range: -1000 to 1000 mV)
 LabSen 335: for pH measurement of wastewater, suspensions, emulsions and other dirty liquids
 LabSen 246-5: for pH measurement of general water solutions with small or micro volume (as low as 60 micro liters)
 LabSen 765: for direct pH measurement of raw or frozen meats (with a blade spear sensor)
 LabSen 805: for pH measurement of pure water e.g. distilled/drinking/RO/surface/boiler/storm/well/deionized water
 LabSen 835: for pH measurement of strong acidic solutions (<pH 2) or HF-containing solutions (HF concentration < 0.1mol/L or 2000 ppm)
 LabSen 845: for pH measurement of strong alkaline solutions (>pH 12) or high salinity solutions (>5000 ppm/0.5%)
 LabSen 855: for pH measurement of viscous liquid samples e.g. skincare products, paints, coatings, slurry, glues, honey, liquid resin
 LabSen 865: for pH measurement of high-temperature and/or corrosive water solutions such as electroplating solutions

 *Note: General Water Solutions are water-based solutions that meet all of the following conditions:
 1) are NOT too acidic or too alkaline (pH range is 2 to 12).
 2) at a temperature between 10°C and 50°C (50˚F to 122˚F).
 3) contain a medium level of dissolved ions (conductivity range: 100 µS/cm to 10,000 µS/cm or salinity level <5000 ppm or 0.5%)

General water solutions e.g. pools and spas, hydroponics, aquaculture, aquarium, water treatment, environmental monitoring, beverage making, education, cooling towers, etc.\nP.S.: General water solutions are fluid that have medium to high ion concentration (conductivity>20µS/cm), at which temperature is 5 to 50˚C, pH is 2 to 12, and non-protein solution\n

 PH60F-DE: for pH measurement on flat samples e.g. paper, skin, textiles, leather, carpet, etc.

 LabSen 855: for pH measurement of viscous liquid samples e.g. skincare products, paints, coatings, slurry, glues, honey, liquid resin

 3) contain a medium level of dissolved ions (conductivity range: 100 µS/cm to 10,000 µS/cm or salinity level <5000 ppm or 0.5%)

For soft solid sampligs direct pH test e.g. cheese, fruit, sushi rice, meat, soil, etc.\nAlso works well for general water solutions e.g. pools and spas, hydroponics, aquaculture, aquarium, water treatment, environmental monitoring, beverage making, education, cooling towers, etc.\nP.S.: General water solutions are fluid that have medium to high ion concentration (conductivity>20µS/cm), at which temperature is 5 to 50˚C, pH is 2 to 12, and non-protein solution

For flat surface direct pH test e.g. skin, paper, fabrics,leather, concrete, and samll volume liquid test.\nAlso works well for general water solutions e.g. pools and spas, hydroponics, aquaculture, aquarium, water treatment, environmental monitoring, beverage making, education, cooling towers, etc.\nP.S.: General water solutions are fluid that have medium to high ion concentration (conductivity>20µS/cm), at which temperature is 5 to 50˚C, pH is 2 to 12, and non-protein solution.
EC60-DE: for conductivity/TDS/salinity/resistivity measurement of water solutions (conductivity range: 0 to 20 mS/20,000 µS)

Please turn on Bluetooth of your phone.
Android requires location services to be turned on for connecting Bluetooth devices
Please enter a name for your asset.
Add a photo of your asset
Max value must be greater than Min
Max value must not exceed the largest measuring range
Min value must not be lower than lowest measuring range
**ALERT** The reading is out of the preset safe range. Please check it ASAP.

Dear users, welcome to use the services provided by Apera Instruments. Before using the service, please read the following service agreement, use of this application means that you agree to accept this agreement, this agreement produces legal effect, especially involving the exemption or limitation of its liability provisions, please read carefully. 

 1. Acknowledgment and Acceptance of Terms of Service

　　By accessing or using this application, the user agrees to accept all the conditions and terms of this agreement.

2. Changes and Modifications of Terms of Service

　　Apera Instruments reserves the right to modify the terms of service when necessary. Once the terms of service are changed, the modifications will be indicated on the important pages. If you do not agree with the modified content, you can give up the information service of this application. If the user continues to enjoy the information services of this application, it is deemed to accept the changes in the terms of service. The application reserves the right to modify or interrupt the service at any time without notice to the user. The Application exercises the right to modify or interrupt the service without being responsible to the User or a third party.

3 User account, password and security

　　You can choose to register and not to register your account according to your needs. When choosing visitor login, the data will be saved locally and will not be uploaded to the cloud server; the disadvantage is that if you change your cell phone login, you will lose the original data. When you choose to register, please use your email address to register, we will not bind your cell phone number or other authentication methods, after registration, please keep your account, the data of the test will be bound to this account; Apera Instruments will properly save the user’s test data.

4. Service Content

　　The specific content of this service is provided by its information according to the actual situation, Apera Instruments can change the service it provides, and the content of the service provided by its information may be changed at any time. The software is a free application. The software is a free application, and the user will not be charged in any way or under any name.

\u3000\u3000Please make sure to carefully read and fully understand the terms of the "Service Agreement" and "Privacy Policy," including but not limited to: in order to provide you with services such as data storage, data testing location, measurement samples, and Bluetooth connection, we need to collect your photos and media, location information, and Bluetooth data. You can view, modify, delete personal information, and manage your authorizations in the "Settings." You can read the "Service Agreement," "Privacy Policy," and "Permission Usage Guidelines" for detailed information. If you agree, please click "Accept" to start using our services.
